com.xilinx.rapidwright.device

Class Device

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.device.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Device
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This is the main class that stores information about Xilinx devices. Each instance is populated to represent a different device.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public static Device getDevice(Part part)
        Gets the unique instance of a device by part, (devices are unique by device name), or loads the device from file if it hasn't been loaded. Also, sets the active package to that of the provided part.
        Parameters:
        part - The part of the device that should be returned/loaded
        Returns:
        The device with the active package set to the part provided.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • releaseDeviceReferences

        @Deprecated
public static void releaseDeviceReferences()
        Deprecated. 
        Clears the singleton map, thus deleting any internal references to the device objects. Deprecated, since the singleton map now only keeps SoftReferences to the Devices, allowing them to be Garbage Collected without having to clear the map.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getDevice

        public static Device getDevice(String partName)
        Gets the unique instance of a device by part name, (devices are unique by device name), or loads the device from file if it hasn't been loaded. Also, sets the active package to that of the provided part.
        Parameters:
        partName - The part name of the device that should be returned/loaded
        Returns:
        The device with the active package set to the part provided.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getPackages

        public Set<String> getPackages()
        Gets and returns the name of all compatible packages for this device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set d []; foreach p [get_parts -filter DEVICE==xcvu9p] {lappend d [get_property PACKAGE $p]};lsort -unique $d

        Returns:
        The names of all compatible packages
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int row,
                    int column)
        Gets the current tile in the device based on absolute row and column indices

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_tiles -filter "ROW==$row && COLUMN==$column"

        Parameters:
        row - The absolute row index (0 starting at top)
        column - The absolute column index (0 starting at the left)
        Returns:
        The tile specified by row and column, if the indices are out of bounds it returns null
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(String name)
        This will get a Tile by its name using a HashMap.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_tiles -filter "NAME==$name"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the tile to get.
        Returns:
        The tile with the name tile, or null if it does not exist.
        Since:
        2018.2.0
        See Also:
        Device.getTile(String, int, int)

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int uniqueTileNumber)
        Each tile in a device can be referenced by a unique integer which is a combination of its row and column index. This will get and return the tile with the unique index provided.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_tiles -filter "INDEX==$uniqueTileNumber"

        Parameters:
        uniqueTileNumber - The unique tile number of the tile to get.
        Returns:
        The tile with the uniqueTileNumber, or null if none exists.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(String nameRoot,
                    int xCoordinate,
                    int yCoordinate)
        This will get a Tile by its name root (as reported by Tile.getNameRoot() ()}) and X/Y coordinates (as reported by Tile.getTileXCoordinate() / Tile.getTileXCoordinate()) using a HashMap of Arrays. The data structure to perform this access efficiently is initialized on first access. Device.getTile(String) essentially performs the same function, but without having to initialize any dedicated data structure first. However, getting arguments from the format of this function to the one of Device.getTile(String) involves String concatenation. For repeated calls, this function is faster.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_tiles -filter "NAME==$prefix_X$xCoordinateY$yCoordinate"

        Parameters:
        nameRoot - The Name Root of the tile to get.
        xCoordinate - The X Coordinate
        yCoordinate - The Y Coordinate
        Returns:
        The tile with the specified name root and coordinates, or null if it does not exist.
        Since:
        2020.2.6
        See Also:
        Device.getTile(String)

      • getTilesByNameRoot

        public Tile[][] getTilesByNameRoot(String nameRoot)
        Get a 2D Array of all Tiles with the specified Name Root (Tile.getNameRoot()).
        Parameters:
        nameRoot - The name root
        Returns:
        All Tiles with this name root as a 2D Array
        Since:
        2020.2.6

      • getSite

        public Site getSite(String name)
        This gets and returns a site on the device by name.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_sites $name"

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the site to get.
        Returns:
        The site with the name, or null if none exists.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Gets and returns the number of rows of tiles in this device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set c 0; foreach t [get_tiles] {if {[get_property COLUMN $t] > $c} {set c [get_property COLUMN $t]} [expr $c + 1]}

        Returns:
        the number of rows of tiles in the device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Gets and returns the number of columns of tiles in this device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set c 0; foreach t [get_tiles] {if {[get_property ROW $t] > $c} {set c [get_property ROW $t]} [expr $c + 1]}

        Returns:
        the number of columns of tiles in the device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTiles

        public Tile[][] getTiles()
        Gets and returns this device's 2D array of tiles that define the layout of the FPGA.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_tiles

        Returns:
        the tiles of this device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getDeviceName

        public String getDeviceName()
        Deprecated. Please use Device.getName() instead
        DEPRECATED: Please use Device.getName() instead Gets and return the deviceName of this device (ex: xcvu9p).

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property DEVICE [get_property PART [current_project]]

        Returns:
        the deviceName The part name of this device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getFamilyType

        public FamilyType getFamilyType()
        Gets the family type of this device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property FAMILY [get_property PART [current_project]]

        Returns:
        The exact Xilinx family type for this device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getArchitecture

        public FamilyType getArchitecture()
        Gets and returns the base architecture for this device. This ensures compatibility with all RapidWright files.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property ARCHITECTURE [get_property PART [current_project]]

        Returns:
        The common architecture type of this device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSeries

        public Series getSeries()
        Gets and returns the series for this device.
        Returns:
        The series to which this device belongs.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getAllCompatibleSites

        public Site[] getAllCompatibleSites(SiteTypeEnum type)
        This method will get all compatible sites for a particular site type in this device. For example, a SLICEL can be placed at all SLICEL sites AND all SLICEM sites. If the type given were SLICEL, this method would return an array of all SLICEL and SLICEM sites.
        Parameters:
        type - The type for which to find compatible sites.
        Returns:
        An array of compatible sites suitable for placement of a site of type type.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getAllSitesOfType

        public Site[] getAllSitesOfType(SiteTypeEnum type)
        Gets and returns an array of all sites of the given site type.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_sites -filter SITE_TYPE==$type

        Parameters:
        type - The site type of the site to get.
        Returns:
        An array of all sites in the device with site type type.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSiteFromPackagePin

        public Site getSiteFromPackagePin(String pkgPinName)
        Gets the site that connects to the named package pin.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_sites -of_objects [get_package_pins $pkgPinName]

        Parameters:
        pkgPinName - Name of the package pin.
        Returns:
        The site that connects to the package pin.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getNumOfClockRegionRows

        public int getNumOfClockRegionRows()
        Gets the number of clock region or fabric sub regions (FSRs) rows in the device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set r 0; foreach cr [get_clock_regions] {if {[get_property ROW_INDEX $cr] > $r} {set r [get_property ROW $cr]} [expr $r + 1]}

        Returns:
        Number of clock regions rows in the device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getNumOfClockRegionsColumns

        public int getNumOfClockRegionsColumns()
        Gets the number of clock regions or fabric sub regions (FSRs) columns in the device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set c 0; foreach cr [get_clock_regions] {if {[get_property COLUMN_INDEX $cr] > $c} {set c [get_property ROW $cr]} [expr $c + 1]}

        Returns:
        Number of clock regions columns in the device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegion

        public ClockRegion getClockRegion(int row,
                                  int col)
        Gets the clock region at the specific row and column index.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_clock_regions -filter "ROW_INDEX==$row && COLUMN_INDEX==$col"

        Parameters:
        row - The row (Y coordinate) of the clock region
        col - The column (X coordinate) of the clock region
        Returns:
        The clock region of interest
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegion

        public ClockRegion getClockRegion(String name)
        Gets the clock region by name, either CLOCKREGION_X2Y2 or X2Y2, both formats are accommodated.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_clock_regions $name

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock region to get, either CLOCKREGION_X#Y# or X#Y#
        Returns:
        The clock region of the given name or null if none could be found.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegions

        public ClockRegion[][] getClockRegions()
        Get the clock region grid.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_clock_regions

        Returns:
        The 2D grid of clock regions on this device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegionFromTile

        public ClockRegion getClockRegionFromTile(String tileName)
        Gets the clock region to which the specified tile belongs.
        Parameters:
        tileName - Name of the tile of interest.
        Returns:
        The clock region of the named tile, or null if could not be determined.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegionFromTile

        public ClockRegion getClockRegionFromTile(Tile tile)
        Gets the clock region to which the specified tile belongs.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile of interest
        Returns:
        The clock region of the tile, or null if could not be determined.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getNumOfSLRs

        public int getNumOfSLRs()
        Gets the total count of SLRs (Super Logic Regions or separate dies) in the device.

        Vivado Tcl:

        llength [get_slrs]

        Returns:
        Total number of SLRs in the device.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSLR

        public SLR getSLR(int id)
        Gets an SLR by its index.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_slrs "SLR${id}"

        Parameters:
        id - SLR index or ID
        Returns:
        The SLR at specified index/ID, or null if none exists.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getMasterSLR

        public SLR getMasterSLR()
        Gets the master SLR (first configured SLR) in the device. In monolithic devices, this simply returns the single SLR.
        Returns:
        The master SLR
        Since:
        2019.2.0

      • getSLRByConfigOrderIndex

        public SLR getSLRByConfigOrderIndex(int cfgOrderIdx)
        Gets the SLR with the specified configuration order index. In multi-die devices, each die or SLR is configured separately and in a specific order. The configuration order index
        Parameters:
        cfgOrderIdx - The configuration order index of the desired SLR.
        Returns:
        The SLR at the specified config order index, or null if none exists.
        Since:
        2019.2.0

        Returns:

        Returns:
        All the tiles in the device.
        Since:

      • getDeviceVersion

        public static String getDeviceVersion(Part part)
        Looks at the current device file for the part name specified and retrieves its current RapidWright device version. The version is specific to RapidWright.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - The part name of the file to check.
        Returns:
        The RapidWright version of the device file, null if part does not exist or is invalid.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getAvailableDevices

        public static List<String> getAvailableDevices()
        Checks for all device files present in the current RapidWright path and returns a list of strings of those part names available to be used by the tool.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set d []; foreach p [get_parts] {lappend d [get_property DEVICE $p]};lsort -unique $d

        Returns:
        A list of available Xilinx parts for use by the tools.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • quietReflectiveAccessWarning

        public static void quietReflectiveAccessWarning()
        Work-around for pervasive illegal access warnings that cause runtime errors in output. See also FileTools
        Since:
        2019.2.2
